channel.title: Galaxy S4
channel.description: How many have one? And how many early adopters got hit with the faulty battery? :)

item.title: Galaxy S4
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

RevengePK:

HTC One ladies. Envy me.

This

My stealth black came today
So far? Love it.
Smooth, sexy looking, not to mention the video recordings/pictures are awesome too

I love blinkfeed, and my hot new wallpaper.
I honestly haven’t tried any games on it yet, but judging by what I’ve seen so far, I’ll like it

As for the speakers and headphones, headphones are pretty awesome, good quality (Both composition and the sound it produces) and doesn’t tangle (Also nice black and red colors, goes great with the phones color)
The speakers are just amazing, coming from the S2 with the speakers on the back, which is also the same with the s3 and s4, it was awesome not only because there are 2, AND they are facing you, but the quality coming out of them is pretty amazing, not just for a phone either.

10/10 would unbox again

Read full topic

item.title: Galaxy S4
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:14, topic:521199”][quote author=Flame_ link=topic=639710.msg4312211#msg4312211 date=1370911469]

I have the S3. I like seeing a better camera on a phone and more features, but it’s a bit overwhelming in my opinion to have so much options on a cell phone.

Just a shame the current battery tech is shite

The S3 lasts quite a long time (up to two and a half days of moderate usage) in one full charge if you have the patience to close all running apps every once in a while, keep it on mid volume and don’t fill up the apps with a bunch of games and unnecessary applications. From what I’ve heard of the S4, you get a good full day of moderate usage before you need to charge it again?

I have the S3. I like seeing a better camera on a phone and more features, but it’s a bit overwhelming in my opinion to have so much options on a cell phone.

I’ve turned a lot of it off, but I do like having air gestures. In my experience a lot of the eye tracking features don’t work as well.

I’m going to assume that there is a calibrating feature?
[/quote]
There is, but it didn’t help too much. Maybe my face is just funny? :o My battery was faulty so if it decided to wonk out and overheat I’d only get 3hrs on it before it would start to melt[/quote]
I did some research on reviews from the calibration and eye tracking, and it seems to me like you probably got a faulty compass calibration-wise. This might be a silly question, but perhaps eye colour plays a part?

Read full topic

item.title: Galaxy S4
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:13, topic:521199”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=639710.msg4312193#msg4312193 date=1370909278]

I have the S3. I like seeing a better camera on a phone and more features, but it’s a bit overwhelming in my opinion to have so much options on a cell phone.

Just a shame the current battery tech is shite
[/quote]
The S3 lasts quite a long time (up to two and a half days of moderate usage) in one full charge if you have the patience to close all running apps every once in a while, keep it on mid volume and don’t fill up the apps with a bunch of games and unnecessary applications. From what I’ve heard of the S4, you get a good full day of moderate usage before you need to charge it again?

I have the S3. I like seeing a better camera on a phone and more features, but it’s a bit overwhelming in my opinion to have so much options on a cell phone.

I’ve turned a lot of it off, but I do like having air gestures. In my experience a lot of the eye tracking features don’t work as well.

I’m going to assume that there is a calibrating feature?[/quote]
There is, but it didn’t help too much. Maybe my face is just funny? :o My battery was faulty so if it decided to wonk out and overheat I’d only get 3hrs on it before it would start to melt

Read full topic

item.title: Galaxy S4
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Soulcist:

I thought they released the S3 recently? I have the S2 (updated a lot as far as the firmware and what not so it doesn’t feel like the regular S2) and love it.

The S3 was late May 2012, so its been about a year. I love my S4 so far, but it gets so hot its uncomfortable to keep in my pocket. Waiting on a replacement

item.title: Galaxy S4
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

10/10 would read again.

The build quality doesn’t feel cheap, but when you compare it to the One its a huge difference. Verizon still doesn’t have the One, and won’t for a while so that was out of the question for me. If it was possible to remove the news feed without a custom rom I definitely would’ve waited, but I don’t want something so stupid bugging me every time I use it.

I got one of the first shipments for Verizon and they have the same battery problems the S3 and Note2 had, guess they will never learn

Read full topic

item.title: Galaxy S4
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

On june 5th i was gonna get it (That was the first day my upgrade was available, and the day after my school ended conveniently) currently I have an S2, and looking at the s3 and s4, there was something that didn’t feel right.
I just didn’t like the build quality, the plastic etc
Then I saw the htc one (I’d read reviews on it before, and thought I’d go with the s4 but that was before I saw it in person)
It was so amazing, so I got that instead, stealth black so they had to special order it, and its actually coming June 10th, today.
And if I don’t like I can switch to the galaxy s4 if I bring the htc back and the s4 back to the htc if i were not to like that s4
But I don’t think I’m gonna switch to the s4

Rate my store 10/10 pls

Read full topic
